title: Arnala Beach
subtitle: A Serene Coastal Escape in Vasai–Virar
overview: Arnala Beach, located in the Palghar district near Virar, is one of the most popular beaches in North Konkan. Known for its black sand and gentle waves, Arnala offers a perfect blend of serenity and local coastal culture.

The nearby Arnala Fort adds historical significance to this location, while its proximity to Mumbai makes it a convenient weekend getaway. The beach is lined with coconut trees, food stalls, and small resorts catering to tourists.
Evenings at Arnala Beach are lively, filled with local vendors, horse rides, and breathtaking sunsets over the Arabian Sea.

highlights.title: Black Sand Shoreline
highlights.description: Unique black sand and calm waters ideal for evening walks and beach activities.

highlights.title: Historic Arnala Fort
highlights.description: A small island fort accessible by boat, offering great views and history dating back to the Portuguese era.

geography.intro: Arnala Beach lies around 8 km from Virar in Palghar district, forming part of the northernmost stretch of the Konkan coastline. It’s known for its gentle sea gradient and soft sandy shore.

details.label: Landscape
details.value: Flat sandy beach lined with palms

climate.description: Arnala enjoys a tropical coastal climate with warm summers, moderate winters, and heavy monsoons.

seasons.text: Best visited between November and February
Avoid during monsoon (June–September) due to high tides

geography.conclusion: Arnala Beach remains a popular local escape for Mumbai residents, offering both cultural vibrance and natural calm.

activities.title: Beach Walks & Picnics
activities.description: Enjoy scenic walks, family outings, and beach games on the wide sandy shore.
info: Local stalls offer snacks and beverages

activities.title: Boat Ride to Arnala Fort
activities.description: Take a short boat trip to explore Arnala Fort, surrounded by sea walls and scenic views.
info: Visit early morning for calm waters

activities.title: Fishing Village Experience
activities.description: Witness daily life of local fishermen and traditional fish markets near the shore.

attractions.title: Arnala Fort
attractions.description: A 16th-century fort built by the Portuguese, accessible by a 10-minute boat ride from the beach.

attractions.title: Virar & Rajodi Beaches
attractions.description: Nearby beaches offering water sports and quieter settings.

marineLife.intro: Arnala’s coastal waters are home to small marine species and fishing zones used by local communities.

items.title: Local Fish Varieties
items.description: Commonly caught species include pomfret, mackerel, and surmai.

items.title: Tidal Life
items.description: Shellfish, crabs, and small mollusks can often be spotted near the rocks.

conclusion: Fishing remains an integral part of local livelihood.
Visitors are encouraged to keep the beach clean and respect marine life.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Auto rickshaws and buses available from Virar to Arnala Beach (approx. 8 km)

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Located about 70 km from Mumbai via NH48 and Virar–Arnala Road
Regular buses available from Vasai and Virar

bookingTips.description: Budget resorts and homestays are available near the beach.
Try local seafood at beachside stalls and eateries.
Visit early morning or late evening to avoid heat and crowds.
